Companion originally thought of ordering the ribs, but was so full from the appetizers that they ordered the Cheeseburger instead. Companion pronounced it to be perfectly cooked and nicely oozing with melted cheese. The burger was served on a brioche bun with all the proper accouterments. On the side were seasoned fries that were truly delicious.

Service was never rushed and our waiter came back to check on our needs often, but without being intrusive. Sanitation was good in the restaurant and the restroom, when I used it was nice and clean and fully supplied.

As followers of my writing are aware, I never let a restaurant know that I am reviewing them unlike some other reviewers. I made my first exception at the conclusion of this meal and complimented the kitchen manager. One has to wonder why, if a place like this can serve outstanding food, can't the rest of food service places follow suit? This was one of the most flavorful and excellent non-fancy meals that I have had the pleasure of enjoying in Phoenix.

I rate this 4 stars for excellent food, great service, and general cleanliness.

Went to this location last night with a close friend. Had a table overlooking Chase Field on a beautiful Arizona evening.

We both had steaks with the loaded mashed photos and steames broccoli. Even though the steaks were a little over cooked from the order, they were on point, and went great with the cold beers.

Finished the meal off with one last drink, the One-Two Rum Punch that our server Curtis made and it was fantastic.
Seriously this place is soooo great! Awesome views of the game and very reasonable prices. I will always eat here when going to dback games! Friendly staff too!

Love the food! The staff is good too, only downside is that they don't have highchairs... or at least that's what we were told. Just for that reason, we won't be back unless it's a "date night" - having to chase a toddler who doesn't like to sit still (unless in a highchair) during dinner isn't an enjoyable experience.

This is a great way to enjoy a game, it's regular Friday's food and 50% of the face value of each table is credited to the food and beverage total. The table is available about 30 minutes before the game.

There was no one in the restaurant, which should've been our first clue to run the other way. Service was exceptionally slow given there were 2 staff members for each one of us. 

I had a salad. And I got food poisoning. It was the only thing I had eaten that day, so no question where I got it. It was horrendous. This place needs to shut their doors, nasty.

While not my first trip to Chase field for a Diamondback game, it was my first time to Friday's Front Row.  

Initially I was concerned about the price, but after learning half the price of our tickets went back to us in food credit, well that seemed like a pretty good deal!  You just have to find a couple friends to go with you... because you do have to buy out an entire table, whether you use all the seats or not.  

My husband and I met our couple friends to check out the game versus the Cubs.  First thing the men noticed?  How much they appreciated the extra room.  The tables are like 1/2 pentagons, a table cut in half facing the field.  The men are both over 6 feet, and not having their knees jammed into the chair in front of them was worth it alone.  

Service was just ok.  They don't have to be awesome, they have a captive audience and they know your bill is going to be at least $130 and gratuity is added in on top of that.  

Food was just ok, your average Friday's fare... if you like it anywhere else you'll like it here.  It's a bit pricer at the field I think, and watch out--the drink prices are considerable (that's because they don't list them!).

Some other cons:  view, if you are really into the game these seats will frustrate you.  It's a good use of the backfield space that would have otherwise been cheap bleacher seats.  But you're looking at the game from a good distance, from the back side.  Also, Fridays is adjacent to the big screen, so you really can't even watch the game or replays on the big screen.  Also con: noise, you're right next to some huge speakers.  While the space would be good for kids, to be able to run around a little more than regular seats... for kids who are noise sensitive, BEWARE.  I was glad we decided to leave our little guy with the grandparents, I think those speakers would have made him pretty unhappy the whole game.

But, for experience alone it was worth it.  Extra room, ability to chat with friends while watching the game, having food and alcohol brought to you without waiting in line (oh, and bathrooms that are close too!).  I think we'll definitely be doing it again next season!

I am not a big fan of TGI Fridays and generally try to avoid chains, but this one is not your average TGIF. We got DBacks season tickets this year and have stopped in at TGIFs before the park opens during happy hour to grab a beer. We normally sit at the bar and the service from the bartenders has been great! The one time we sat at one of the 1 hour limit tables, we were waited on by a recent transplant from the east coast. He was EXTREMELY friendly and gave us great service. Something I have not experienced at a TGIF recently. This is a great spot to watch batting practice but as far as watching the game not so much for me. The restaurant sits above the outfield in left and it's difficult to see the game unless you've spent the extra $$$ to sit on the balcony and I DO go to see the game. I hope to stop in here sometime soon (preferably celebrating a DBacks win) postgame to experience the restaurant and review again.

This is the best place to take out of town guests!  I love suggesting for them to grab their camera (or cell phone camera) and let's go to the ballpark.  It's a wild experience during a game, but I much much rather do it when there's no game on.  That way, we can sit (practically) anywhere we want and see the ball park.  My friends love it and love showing off their photos when they get home.  And as to the food, I have to, have to have the offerings that have their Jack Daniels Sauce.  OMG I love that stuff!  Wish I could have a tub of that sauce at home!  There's a few people out there that don't have any interest in baseball, so they would be there for the food.  But really, it's a great place to show how unique and amazing Phoenix is.   The service has always been good and so has the food.... did I mention the Jack Daniels Sauce?

Good place to watch game if u have smaller kids..u have food service so u don't have your kids as tag a longs to wait in line for snacks and drinks and spill half of it before u can make it back down the stairs to ur seats.
Food fairly priced however I WILL NEVER PAY 3.50 at a restaurant for a small soda that does not have free refills again 15.00 for 4 sodas are u kidding! The $11.00 8 piece boneless wing order was nothing more that heavily breaded chicken nuggets with hot wing sauce splashed on them ( will NEVER order those again). Would not be complaining about our 60.00 bill ( 2 kids meals, 4 sodas, 4 scoops of ice cream 2 for each kid and 1 club sandwich and  boneless nuggets) if it was not for the no refill policy and I ordered a better appetizer.

If you're eating here because you've never been to Chase Stadium, walk in, see the stadium, take your picture and get the hell out.  I just saved you about two hours of frustration. You are welcome.  Or you can dine here, like my wife and I regrettably did.  We walked in, and requested to sit by the window... They told us it would be five minutes so we told them no problem at all.  We sat at the bar for 10 minutes, and though the bartender did wave at us, he never took our order.  Then the manager finally came and sat us at a regular table.  I told him we had been waiting for the table with a view, and it was almost as if I had asked him for his social security number.  He fumbled his words, and hesitantly spit out the words "I have a waiting list"... There were three empty tables and the restaurant was not full AND THEY DONT TAKE RESERVATIONS! So...WTF???  So we waited a bit longer and finally the nervous un assertive manager found us a table.  Cool...now we have been seated and decided to leave that little first impression behind us.  that's when we met our waitress.  Literally had to tell her every aspect of her job, step by step.  It was like we were training her on her first day of a waitress.  I literally would have gotten my food faster if I was waiting in line for a dodger dog on opening day....and only one hotdog stand was open.

It's hot. You're bored. And you're hungry. What to do? 

Why not catch a D-Backs game at Friday's Front Row Sports Grill?  It's a great way to see Chase Field and you'll get a bird's eye view of left field and third base. 

The food is okay- the menu has the standard TGI Friday's items, like wings, cheese sticks, fajitas, burgers etc. and the service is pretty good too. 

The restaurant has a full bar, and it sure beats leaving the game every hour (okay, half hour) to get a new beer or margarita. 

Friday's Front Row is family friendly and a great place to take the kids.  And there doesn't even have to be a game going on for you to come have lunch and check out Chase Field.

Worst service in downtown Phoenix.  It is like the wait staff does not even care. Go for the atmosphere and the food, deal with the staff best you can. Would imagine would be great during a ball game, I will still go back despite poor experiences. I wish they would step up their game.

Came on a quiet day, no Dback game but still a beautiful view. I love the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich and this is why we decided to come lol. Ordered a Tropical Berry Mojito shaker which was ok, I would've liked more lime/citrus flavor as it was really sweet and tasted more like the berry syrup. Server was decent, and checked with us a few times. Mainly here for the Jack Daniels sauce lol
If you are a baseball fan and you are visiting Pheonix, this is a must.  Enjoy good food and watch baseball.  Great atmosphere, and most importantly good service.

The only good point about Friday's Front Row is the view.  My wife and I had come about 2 hours early for the Diamondbacks' game and decided to eat at Friday's Front Row rather than eat the stadium junk food for supper.

When we arrived, the waitress wanted to seat us in the booths away from the window, despite there being several open tables next to the window overlooking the field and the players having batting practice.  We had to push for getting a seat next to the window because those seats weren't in her zone.  So for us sitting there, she had to surrender us to another waitress.  So goes the competitive world of being a waitress.  We just wanted the better seat.

Now in our better seat next to the window and watching the Reds' players having batting practice, we had 20 minutes to look at the menus because the waitress was quite slow in returning to take our order.  This despite a sign on the table saying that patrons were limited to 1 hour at this table.

We finally ordered.  I got the Jack Daniels Burger while my wife got a salad.  My burger wasn't that great.  Not that big of a meat patty and it was lukewarm.  It probably had been sitting for a few minutes before the waitress ever brought it out.

Anyway.  Eat here for the atmosphere, not for the food.

I tried this place to show some friends the stadium in the offseason and we had a bogo coupon. It was deffinatley a Fridays. Nothing great, nothing awful just decent chain food. The atmosphere cool, and if you like baseball check it out. The best deal is happy hour 4-7 which has $4 appetizers and $2 beers. It worth a visit but don't expect a 5 star dinner.
Great food. great view of the ball park. cant wait to go back there

Best place for macaroni bites! Yummy goodness in a bite wit bacon on top and melted cheese.

Add to your apps! Dumplings were a surprise on the menu because you think, what Chinese? They are amazing though! 

If your in for just apps and drinks or a sit down dinner the views are awesome and the atmosphere is lovely! Never had to wait for an open table. Which is surprising because the place seems smaller than a regular restaurant.

Going in - you know your going to get typical TGIF food.  But the view is great!  If you're a sports junky you need to eat here once.  We took my grandfather, a sports nut, for lunch (hopped off the light rail) and he loved it.  As we ate lunch on the "patio" we watched as the landscapers groomed the field.  The top was open, the sun was shining, a breeze was blowing...ahhh..  The service was perfect.  Our server was funny - took time to chat and made sure we had what we needed as soon (or before) we needed it.

One of the few American Food chains in downtown Phoenix.  While I don't like chain restaurants, it is always nice to have a place where you can count on a certain dish no matter where in the country you go.  

This Friday's is quite different than most.  Gone are the red & white striped awnings and, in their place, are rows of Dbacks and other baseball memorabilia lining the walls.   If you are a baseball fan, you will love this place simply because of the decor.  If that wasn't enough, you get to enjoy the signs and sounds of a major league baseball game (81 days of the year) and the field itself for every other day.  All in all, a pretty nice setup.

This Friday's does tend to be priced a bit higher than others in the area.  The service is also much slower.  Also, if you are watching the Dbacks play, you may lose your appetite.

Been about a year and a half since I updated this review. Stopped in here on a Saturday night and me and my goofball both got the endless apps. They said as long as we only got one app at a time it would only be $12 even though we were both eating. Our apps were replaced in reasonable time and as always the servers were great... they even put the Coyote's game on the TV for us to watch as it was not on one where we were seated. It was a nice dinner, and for desert since it was pi day I got a piece of peanut butter chocolate pie. It is definitely a small piece for the price (and I am spoiled with My Mother's which one slice about the same price is like 1/4 a pie) but was good. Will I be back? Of course... just not for game days since they crank up thier prices even more and remove a good portion of the menu.

We decided to take our son here for dinner on his last night in town because the boy loves baseball. We were a little bummed that everything inside the stadium was dark so we could not really see the field. We were able to go out into the stadium itself on the restaurant patio which in itself was pretty cool.

The food here was actually quite good. I had the Jack Daniels flat iron steak and it was awesome. My hubby had the JD Burger not complaints either. To drink I had the BFM (Best Friday's Margarita) which was $10..total waste. Not only did it have a strange taste, but very weak. Next time I will just stick with an ice cold beer.

Overall we had a nice time and while the drinks were a little spendy I think the food prices were about average.

I came here with a group and I must say that the service was friendly and efficient considering the size of the group. The location, inside chase field, is very nice and you can see the park from the tables. The lunch specials were decently priced, including a salad or bruschetta.... but the food was nothing special. I had the bruschetta, French onion soup, and fries... everything was bit salty, but not terrible. Would I come here again? Probably not, but you could do worse.

My friend and I decided to try out TGI Fridays for a beer during the baseball game to get a bigger bang for our buck. For what we would pay for a small hot dog and 20 oz beer, we could get a great meal, larger beers, and great service, right?! Wrong. 

The restaurant was not very crowded for a game night, yet we were denied a table overlooking the stadium. Twice. The manager asked us to visit the hostess stand to get a table, but they informed us there was a wait. NO ONE WAS IN LINE FOR THE RESTAURANT! 

I had to get our own menus from the bar, after playing "let's avoid making eye contact, and maybe she will go away." After we ordered, three sets of people were sat in the tables we were waiting for, and their meals came out before our order! 

Our waiter ended up offering us a free beer for the late arrival of our food, and ended up comping our entire check, but that will be my last visit "Front Row." 

I'd rather pay $10 for a beer and $8 for a processed hot dog than to get snobbed by anyone in the service industry. All I wanted was a good time after a work day from hell, and to enjoy a Diamondbacks game ...

Stood there for 15 min waiting to order a beer. Bartender helped those that came after me several times. 

We were wearing opposing team jerseys, but still not an excuse.

I stumbled upon this Friday's while walking around Phoenix on a Sunday afternoon.  I wanted to just go up and have a drink and then take some pictures of the empty baseball field.  Phoenix was completely empty!

When I got closer to Chase Field there were some more people and I realized that there was a game going on!  I didn't think I would be able to get into Friday's because of the game; however, it wasn't very busy!  I sat at the bar since I was by myself.  But once I was there awhile, I noticed there were still tables open looking out into the ballpark.  So basically you get to watch the game for free as long as you are ordering stuff.  I thought that was pretty cool.

As for the food/drink...
I ordered a daiquiri when I sat down.  It was pretty bad.  Almost too slushy.  I looked through the menu and asked if they had any smaller portions or lunch portion.  I was told that since it was a game day they have a different menu and everything is larger.  So I didn't order any food.

The service was good.  The waiter was nice and another waitress named Kimmy even came up and talked to me for a little while.  I'd definitely come here again just for the view.

The Good:
1. Great location!
2. Awesome atmosphere during events.
3. Beer is cheaper here than in the concourse. 
4. Great place to take out of town friends and family to.

The Bad:
1. Typical TGI Fridays food.
2. Its a bit pricey compared to a regular Fridays.
3. Limited menu on event days.

This is a great concept with a great view of the field.  We didn't sit here for the game, but instead went in to watch batting practice.  On top of that we just had beers.  Apparently, they sell tickets for the games at the restaurant and clear out the seats a little before game time.

Epic Failure!

Went for lunch with a coworker. Sat for nearly 10 minutes without a waiter/waitress coming to our table. We watched people who arrived after us get their drink orders taken and delivered during that same time period. 

The only time when we thought our waiter discovered us is when we got up to leave for a different restaurant. Someone was chasing after us as we walked to the elevator.

The hostess was equally clueless. She apparently didn't recognize us as the people she brought to a table only moments ago and asked if we enjoyed our lunch.

The place was only a third full at most. No reason for the extremely poor service.

Can't wait until Sliders opens for the season!

This TGI Fridays is an epic failure!

We should have turned around when we saw the sign "now hiring all positions." We didn't. Took five mins for hostess(es) to stop their conversation to seat us. The server took 10 minutes to come see us (there were four tables and three servers) she obviously didn't want to be there and it showed. My mom ordered medium well burger and it came back barely cooked. After 40 minute wait to get our food she just ate it. Don't bother.

It's nice having a Friday's fairly close to my house in downtown.  Unfortunately, this one does not provide me with the same quality of service and value for food as the other ones do.  I appreciate the change of decor here, as this Friday's is definitely geared around the Dbacks and not the usual kitschy crap.  The food here is just as good/average as at the other locations, but I feel a little ripped off coming here.  It's always more expensive, but I guess I can understand given the neat view.  I've never been on a gameday, but I can't imagine how awful that could be.  Service is terrible here, even when nothing is going on.  Factor in the chaotics that a game most certainly brings and you set yourself up for disaster.  This is not going to be a quick or cheap meal.  If you are looking for an interesting place to kind of hang out in downtown when there isn't a game going on, Friday's Front Row is a pretty good choice, plus it's right off a lightrail stop.

Decent place, one of the servers sent our food to the wrong table but other than that the service was good. The view of the field is amazing. I didn't go during a game so I can only imagine how alive this place can get. I'd come here again. :)

We went there with a large group of people after a volleyball tournament that was at the convention center across the street. It was convenient and next to the parking garage so you don't have to leave and find parking again. 

The food was like typical diner food. It wasn't anything special but I'm not a huge Friday's fan. In the past few years I've been twice and both times were at this same location. Also, they had a fixed menu for special event seating which I assumed was because we had a large group but not really sure. There was different options but it wasn't their full menu. 

The service was slow but the waiter was nice. We had a group of 15. Each group got separate checks which is good but we got them all at different times and they weren't all correct. The food didn't always come out correct either. 

I would give it two stars but the location and the view of the Diamondbacks stadium was awesome. We sat facing the ballpark and could imagine how cool it was be to sit there during a game. It also has outside access so you can get closer to the field and look around the stadium and take pictures. That is the reason I come here and probably why I'll come back.
